name: "Still the King" - The Pilot Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: Vernon Brownmule was arrested after crashing a vehicle during a drunken, high-speed cruise. What type of vehicle was it?
questions.explanation:
A bread truck.

	The opening narration starts with him saying "For the record I'm normally a really good driver", as the camera shows a crash site. He said he was doing 90 miles and hour in a stolen bread truck while pouring a Jack and coke for a female companion. He was arrested at the crash scene.

questions.text: What had derailed Vernon Brownmule's career 20 years before the events of the pilot?
questions.correct: An arrest for having a minor in his hotel room.
options: He was stabbed and quit performing.
A traffic crash that crushed his vocal cords.
He went into the monastery and gave up singing.
questions.explanation:
An arrest for having a minor in his hotel room.

	He was arrested in the 1990s for having the sheriff's daughter in his hotel room. She was one day away from her 18th birthday. He also had a lot of drugs and other illegal substances in the hotel room. His stage name was Vernon Brown.

questions.text: How old was the daughter Vernon discovered he had during his meeting with his probation officer?
questions.explanation:
15 years old.

	He was told that he owed 15 years worth of back child support for his daughter, Charlotte. Up until that point he didn't know about her because his manager had never told him about the letters the mother had sent through to him.

questions.text: What state was Vernon told he couldn't leave for a full calendar year?
questions.explanation:
Tennessee.

	He was stuck in the music capital of the world, and despite having a former number one record, he couldn't even get a job singing in a bar. He also had to provide community service at the church he had damaged with the bread truck.

True.

	He showed up at the church to do community service, and overheard the blind caretaker talking about hiring a new preacher. He stepped in and told the man he was the new preacher. He was given free lodging, the paycheck and half the weekly offerings. He then hired a former friend's son to act like the convict and do community service at the church.

questions.text: What food did Walt find in the fridge at the church?
questions.explanation:
Ribs.

	He asked Vernon what the difference between "best by" and the "sell by" date was. They both ate a bunch of the ribs, drank some communion wine and then decided to go try to meat Charlotte. Walt was the man hired to pretend to be the criminal doing community service.

questions.text: What restaurant did Vernon and Walt end up eating at after they failed to meet up with Charlotte?
questions.explanation:
Brother Z's Wang Shack.

	Vernon passed out in the bed of a truck and woke up with a goat sniffing him. Walt was passed out in the cab of the truck. It was Sunday morning and Vernon was supposed to be preaching for the first time.

questions.text: Who was just starting to preach when Rev. Johnson arrived at the church?
questions.explanation:
Vernon.

	He was standing at the podium figuring out exactly what to say. At first he imagined it going well. Then as the scene cut back to reality as he started to speak, the real Rev. Johnson arrived at the church and the credits rolled on the episode.

questions.text: What style of music had Vernon perform when he was a recording star?
questions.explanation:
Country.

	Much like the actor who played him, Vernon was a one-hit wonder in the country music scene. Unlike Billy Ray Cyrus though, Vernon turned to crime when his fame waned, whereas the real singer turned to acting.

questions.text: Charlotte's mother, Debbie, and Vernon had been in a long committed relationship before he went to prison and she got pregnant.
questions.explanation:
False.

	According to the series continuity he had gone to prison 20 years ago, and Charlotte was only 15. Debbie and Vernon's relationship was a one-night stand. Based on that continuity, Vernon spent less than 4.5 years in prison on the charges, though the exact time was not mentioned in the pilot.
